review_title: Beautiful Campus, Stiffling Work Environment, No Vision
pros: The campus is absolutely gorgeous.  It is possible to develop deep and supportive connections with co-workers.  Tuition benefit but only for undergrad and MA - not PhD.  35 hour work week, a week off at Christmas, good vacation (3 weeks for salaried positions, and 4 weeks at 5 years.  The students are wonderful.  Good health benefits and 7% employer (additional 1% if employee contributes 1%) contribution to pension.
cons: The hierarchy is stifling. There are layers and layers of higher-ups which continues to grow even though the student population stays the same. Although most of the staff are highly educated and accomplished and have great problem solving skills, the culture does not allow for contribution to the vision and strategy..  The IT department is behind the times and follows policies which inhibit getting work done.  Lack of communication from the top and between departments.  Staff promotions and tenure decisions often seem to lack fairness.  Salaries are very low which forces 60% of the staff to have an additional part-time jobs to cover the cost of basic living expenses.

review_title: Politics are tough. School is really run by the accountants. Lots of employee turnover.
pros: Beautiful location in Newport, RI next to the cliff walk. Stunning buildings (I work in a guilded age mansion). Most people are really nice--especially faculty and students.
cons: My supervisor is a micromanager and is never pleased with my work. Also has a bad attitude, abusive to me and my coworkers. Brought it up to upper management and HR, who refuses to do anything about it. If you've been working here for 10+ years, they'll let you do whatever you want. Politics inside the university is particularly complicated. If you want to work here, be prepared for dealing with loads of red tape to get anything done. Pay is not great--be prepared to get 10-25% less than what you would be paid at another school.
